intro: Crenularia eunomioides, commonly known as the African snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom during the winter months. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Crenularia eunomioides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
